body.h1: WSO2 Governance Registry - Guide for Webdav Mounting Support

body.p: Webdav is a very popular way to mount the remote file system to your machine and keep it synchronized with the remote file system. So with Governance Registry Webdav support we are allowing users to mount Registry resources in to your local file system and keep up to date with the Registry resources.

Before using webdav support with Governance Registry you need to install webdav client to your local machine based on your operating system. Ex: If you are an Ubuntu user you can install devfs2 by running the following command
body.h3: How to configure davfs2 in your local file system
body.p: Add the follwoing entries into davfs2.conf file. There is a system wide configuration file /etc/davfs2/davfs2.conf and user configuration files ~/.davfs2/davfs2.conf. When mount.davfs is invoked by root, only the system wide configuration file is read. When invoked by an ordinary user, the user configuration file is read in addition, and the user configuration takes precedence over the system wide configuration.
Imortant Note: Without these settings, WebDAV may not function as expected.
body.h3: How to mount Registry to your local file system
body.p: Use following steps to mount the complete Registry root in to your file system (/mnt/webdav directory) if you are a Linux User.

ol.li: Create a directory /mnt/webdav1 in your system.
During the mounting process give the username/password of a user who has read permission in to Registry root.
This will mount complete GREG root to your directory created in /mnt/webdav1

body.h2: On Windows XP, Vista and Win7
body.p: Microsoft WebDAV client is called WebDAV Mini Redirector and allows one to map a WebDAV location to a Drive letter.
By default, Windows Firewall blocks network discovery (formerly called UPnP technology), but you can enable it.

Open Network and Sharing Center by clicking the Start button , clicking Control Panel, clicking Network and Internet, and then clicking Network and Sharing Center. If network discovery is off, click the arrow button â€Œ to expand the section. Click Turn on network discovery, and then click Apply. If you are prompted for an administrator password or confirmation, type the password or provide confirmation.

Open Advanced sharing settings by clicking the Start button , and then clicking Control Panel. In the search box, type network, click Network and Sharing Center, and then, in the left pane, click Change advanced sharing settings.
body.h3: How to mount Registry to your local file system
body.p: Use following steps to mount the complete Registry root in to your file system.

ol.li: Right click on My Computer and select Map Network Drive.
In the Folder "entry field", enter the URL(https://localhost:9443/registry/resourcewebdav), and click Finish.
Enter your username and password of a user who has read permission in to Registry root in the authentication box that appears.
This will mount complete GREG root as a network drive.
